item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, March 17, 2025 at 12:35 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The Alexa feature "Do Not Send Voice Recordings" you enabled no longer available (492 points | 261 comments)
2. Can a LLM convert C, to ASM to specs and then to a working Z/80 Speccy tape? Yes (35 points | 25 comments)
3. Launching RDAP; sunsetting WHOIS (579 points | 243 comments)
4. Stupid Smart Pointers in C (10 points | 4 comments)
5. uv downloads overtake Poetry for Wagtail users (167 points | 140 comments)
6. The exceptional Jordan algebra (2020) (46 points | 3 comments)
7. Nango (YC W23, Product Integrations Platform) Is Hiring Remote Engineers ( | hide)
8. 22% Drop in Programming Jobs (13 points | 3 comments)
9. Docs – Open source alternative to Notion or Outline (1514 points | 402 comments)
10. Meta puts stop on promotion of tell-all book by former employee (35 points | 12 comments)
11. Show HN: Beyond Jira: Lightweight Project Management for Freelancers (14 points | 7 comments)
12. Compression of Spectral Images Using Spectral JPEG XL (27 points | 4 comments)
13. The Trials of an Exorcist, 1597 (10 points | discuss)
14. Conducting forensics of mobile devices to find signs of a potential compromise (86 points | 14 comments)
15. Checkers written in Rust and exported to WASM (53 points | 13 comments)
16. Going down the rabbit hole of Git's new bundle-URI (220 points | 71 comments)
17. Image Processing in C – Dwayne Phillips [pdf] (69 points | 13 comments)
18. Recommendations for designing magic numbers of binary file formats (51 points | 11 comments)
19. Pine64's RISC-V tablet now ships with a Debian-based Linux and improved hardware (24 points | 1 comment)
20. Scientists discover first known animal that doesn't breathe (8 points | 1 comment)
21. Zlib-rs is faster than C (266 points | 341 comments)
22. Technical Mathematics (1954) [pdf] (15 points | 2 comments)
23. Teach, Don't Tell (2013) (158 points | 45 comments)
24. Artificial photosynthesis directed toward organic synthesis (47 points | 8 comments)
25. Genomic study indicates our capacity for language emerged 135,000 years ago (30 points | 15 comments)
26. When the Dotcom Bubble Burst (194 points | 171 comments)
27. Amiga 600: From the Amiga No One Wanted to Retro Favorite (136 points | 91 comments)
28. Did the Particle Go Through the Two Slits, or Did the Wave Function? (166 points | 216 comments)
29. That Time I Recreated Photoshop in C++ (252 points | 110 comments)
30. Show HN: 10 teams are racing to build a pivotal tracker replacement (122 points | 64 comments)
